column118: Figures 1 and extended data figures 2 and 4
column129: Epitope-specific cells were isolated from tonsil tissue by tetramer staining and single-cell TCR sequences were obtained.

column6: Jacob Glanville; Huang Huang; Allison Nau; Olivia Hatton; Lisa E Wagar; Florian Rubelt; Xuhuai Ji; Arnold Han; Sheri M Krams; Christina Pettus; Nikhil Haas; Cecilia S Lindestam Arlehamn; Alessandro Sette; Scott D Boyd; Thomas J Scriba; Olivia M Martinez; Mark M Davis
column9: Identifying specificity groups in the T cell receptor repertoire.
column51: Exposure with existing immune reactivity without evidence for disease
column117: Donors are asymptomatic teenagers with latent TB infection as determined by QFT test positivity. PBMCs were stimulated with M. tuberculosis lysate for 12 h or pwith a large collection of M. tuberculosis peptides (n = 300) for 4 respectively, and activated CD4+ T cells were selected on the basis of increased surface expression of CD154 or cytokine secretion. Single cells were sorted into 96-well plates and amplified and the TCRs were sequenced. Selected TCRs were lentivirally transduced in  J76-NFATRE-luc cells.
column129: Epitope screening was performed with a luciferase assay where transduced cells were co-cultured wit HLA-transduced K562 cells and single peptides and luciferase activity was measured after 8 h.

column6: Jacob Glanville; Huang Huang; Allison Nau; Olivia Hatton; Lisa E Wagar; Florian Rubelt; Xuhuai Ji; Arnold Han; Sheri M Krams; Christina Pettus; Nikhil Haas; Cecilia S Lindestam Arlehamn; Alessandro Sette; Scott D Boyd; Thomas J Scriba; Olivia M Martinez; Mark M Davis
column9: Identifying specificity groups in the T cell receptor repertoire.
column51: Exposure with existing immune reactivity without evidence for disease
column117: Donors are asymptomatic teenagers with latent TB infection as determined by QFT test positivity. PBMCs were stimulated with M. tuberculosis lysate for 12 h or pwith a large collection of M. tuberculosis peptides (n = 300) for 4 respectively, and activated CD4+ T cells were selected on the basis of increased surface expression of CD154 or cytokine secretion. Single cells were sorted into 96-well plates and amplified and the TCRs were sequenced. Selected TCRs were lentivirally transduced in J76-NFATRE-luc cells. From one of those TCRs, prediction and testing of residues of the CDR3β that affect binding lead to the generation of de novo variants not found in the donors.
column118: Figures 3, 4, 5, extended data figure 8 and  supplementary table 4.
column129: Epitope screening was performed with a luciferase assay where transduced cells were co-cultured wit HLA-transduced K562 cells and single peptides and luciferase activity was measured after 8 h. For the de novo TCR variants generated, two of them (De12 and De15) showed improve sensitivity over the original TCR025.
column135: De09, De11, De12, De14, De15, De16, De17, De18, TCR024, TCR025
